PRIVACY.TITLE: Privacy Policy
PRIVACY.SUBTITLE: Commitment to your anonymity and data security.
PRIVACY.LAST_UPDATED: Last updated: December 2025 â€¢ BluntBox Privacy Team
PRIVACY.SECTION1_TEXT: BluntBox is built on the core principle of anonymity. When you send a message:
SECTION1_LIST: We do not display your IP address, location, or device information to the recipient.
We do not require you to create an account to send messages.
If you are logged in, your identity remains hidden unless you explicitly choose to toggle "Public" or sign your name in the message body.
PRIVACY.SECTION2_TEXT: To provide our service, we collect limited data:
SECTION2_LIST: Account Information: If you sign up, we store your username and a hashed version of your password. We do not store raw passwords.
Message Content: The text content of messages sent and received is stored on our secure servers to allow retrieval by the recipient.
Technical Logs: Minimal server logs are kept for a short period solely for debugging and preventing abuse.
PRIVACY.SECTION3_TEXT: We use local storage technology (not tracking cookies) solely to keep you logged in to your dashboard. We do not use third-party tracking pixels or advertising cookies.
PRIVACY.SECTION4_TEXT: You have total control over your data. You can delete your account at any time, which will permanently erase your profile and all received messages from our database.
PRIVACY.SECTION5_TEXT: We implement industry-standard security measures. All data in transit is encrypted via SSL/TLS. Passwords are hashed using bcrypt before storage.

FAQ.TITLE: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.SUBTITLE: Common questions about using BluntBox.
FAQ.A1: Yes, 100%. We do not share your identity with the recipient. They will never know who sent a message unless you explicitly write your name in the message content.
FAQ.Q2: Can I find out who sent me a message?
FAQ.A2: No. We do not store or reveal information that links a specific message to a real-world identity. This ensures users feel safe to be honest.
FAQ.Q3: Why can't I see some messages?
FAQ.A3: All messages go through an automated moderation filter. Messages containing hate speech, severe harassment, or explicit threats may be blocked automatically or flagged for review. Currently, 'Pending' messages are not displayed until approved.
FAQ.Q4: How do I reply to a message?
FAQ.A4: Click on any message in your dashboard to view the full thread. At the bottom, you will see a reply box. You can choose to reply publicly (visible on your public profile) or keep it private.
FAQ.Q5: How can I share my profile?
FAQ.A5: On your Dashboard, there is a 'Copy Link' button. Click it to copy your unique profile URL to your clipboard, then paste it on Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, or wherever you like!
FAQ.Q6: Can I delete a message I sent?
FAQ.A6: Once a message is sent, it cannot be deleted by the sender. This prevents users from sending abusive content and then hiding the evidence. However, the recipient can choose to hide or ignore any message they receive.
FAQ.A7: No, your messages will remain in your inbox indefinitely unless you choose to delete your account. We may implement an auto-archive feature for very old messages in the future, but for now, they are here to stay.
FAQ.A8: Technically yes, but we encourage using a single authentic identity to build better connections. If you lose access to an account, we recommend contacting support rather than creating a duplicate.
FAQ.Q9: Is my email visible to others?
FAQ.A9: Absolutely not. Your email address is strictly used for account recovery and important system notifications. It is never displayed on your public profile or shared with third parties.
FAQ.Q10: What if I forgot my password?
FAQ.A10: Since the 'Forgot Password' feature is currently in development, please contact our support team at support@bluntbox.com with your username and registered email, and we will assist you with a manual reset.
FAQ.A11: Not yet! We are currently building the account management features. The 'Change Password' option in Settings will be enabled in a future update.
FAQ.Q12: Is there an app for iOS or Android?
FAQ.A12: BluntBox is currently a web-only application. However, our website is fully responsive and works great on mobile browsers like Safari and Chrome.
FAQ.Q13: How do I report abusive content?
FAQ.A13: We take safety seriously. If you receive a message that bypasses our filters and makes you feel unsafe, please contact our support email (support@bluntbox.com) with a screenshot, and we will take immediate action.
